name: Six-Month Spanish B1 Accelerator
description: Consumer-grade prompt for language learning curriculum design

request.base_prompt:
Six‑Month Spanish‑B1 Accelerator
=================================
Objective
Design a learning roadmap that takes an English speaker from A2 to solid B1 Spanish in 180 days.

Inputs
• The learner has 45 min/day on weekdays, 2 h Saturday, rest Sunday.
• Prefers podcasts + interactive apps over textbooks.

<OPTIONAL: paste any favourite resources you already use>

Process
1. Retrieve CEFR‑B1 can‑do statements using [LOOKUP("Official CEFR B1 descriptors")].
2. Build a 26‑week table: Week #, Primary Skill Target, Key Resources, Daily Micro‑Task.
3. Inject spaced‑repetition:
   • For each new vocabulary set, schedule 3 reviews: +2 days, +7 days, +30 days.
4. Self‑Consistency
   • Draft schedules with **two** pacing strategies (Linear vs. Sprint‑Rest).
   • Use a quick rubric to pick the better schedule (criteria: retention likelihood, burnout risk).
5. Monitoring Algorithm
   Provide pseudocode that, each Sunday, asks the learner to self‑rate skill areas 1‑5 and auto‑shifts the next week's focus if any score < 3.
6. Output Sections
   A. 140‑char motivational headline
   B. Final Week‑by‑Week table (markdown)
   C. Pseudocode block for the monitor
   D. Self‑evaluation table: realism, flexibility, evidence quality (score 0‑1 each)
